changes.title: 2-Step Voucher Redemption Workflow with Recipient Approval
changes.description: Complete redesign of voucher redemption system based on critical user feedback - shop owners can now request partial redemptions, and recipients must approve each redemption request in real-time
details: Added RedemptionRequest database model to track pending redemption requests
Shop owners can now enter custom redemption amount (partial redemption support)
Modified /vendor/redeem-voucher endpoint to create pending requests instead of immediate redemption
Added /api/recipient/redemption-requests endpoint to fetch pending requests
Added /api/recipient/redemption-requests/<id>/respond endpoint for approve/reject actions
Implemented real-time Socket.IO event 'redemption_request' to notify recipients instantly
Created beautiful redemption approval modal in RecipientDashboard with shop details, amount, and balance info
Added approve/reject buttons with reason input for rejections
Added auto-expiration timer (5 minutes) for pending requests
Recipients can see time remaining for each request
Vendor receives real-time notification when recipient approves/rejects
Updated VendorDashboard success message to indicate 'request sent' instead of 'redeemed'
Added pending redemption requests counter in RecipientDashboard
Implemented queue system for multiple simultaneous redemption requests
Added database migration script for RedemptionRequest table
changes.impact: CRITICAL USER FEEDBACK ADDRESSED: (1) Shop owners can now redeem only actual purchase amount instead of full voucher, (2) Recipients have full control and must approve each redemption, (3) Prevents unauthorized full-voucher redemptions. This fundamentally changes the redemption workflow to be recipient-centric and secure.
affectedComponents: backend/app.py - Modified redemption endpoints and added approval endpoints
Socket.IO - Added redemption_request and redemption_response events
